original: Lundberg, Hjalmar, major, Göteborg, f. 23/7/94 i Skellefteå av Johannes L. o. Maria Kristina Forslund. G. 21 m. Inez Sjödin. Barn: Göran f. 26. — Stud:ex. 14, off:ex. 17, kulspr:-skjutsk. 21, AIHS 22-23, ridsk. å Strömsholm 24-25, gymn :lär :kurs v. GCI 26-28, tjänst v. LKE 29-30, KHS 30-32, granatkast :kurs 33, pansar-värnskurs 37. Lantmäteriauskult. 14-15, distriktschef i Försäkrings A-B Fylgia sed. 42, inneh. fastigh :byrå. Styrelseledamot i Jämtl.-Härjedalens gymn:förb. 33-39, i Sv. gångförb. 34-39 m. m. Stud:vist. i Frankr. 25-26, res. i Mellaneuropa 21, t. EngL, Belg., Syd-, Mellan- o. Nordamer., Mexiko, Kanada m. fl. länder 30, Balticum o. Finl. 32, i Nord- o. Sydeuropa 39, Schw^eiz o. Italien 47. Skr.: ett stort antal tidningsartiklar i polit., nat:ekon. o. relig. frågor. Hoibbies: ridning, bil- o. kanotsport. RSO, Gymn:- o. idr:förb. GM, Gymn:främj. GM, LandstSM, guldmärken i allm. idr., mil. idr., skidlöpn., skytte o. pistolsky tte, Arméns skytteM f. gevär o. ksp, FäktSm m. m.
translated: Lundberg, Hjalmar, Major, Gothenburg, b. July 23, 1894 in Skellefteå to Johannes L. and Maria Kristina Forslund. Married on the 21st with Inez Sjödin. Children: Göran b. 1926. Education: High school graduation in 1914, officer's examination in 1917, machine gun shooting course in 1921, AIHS (Artillery and Engineering Higher School) from 1922-1923, equestrian course at Strömsholm from 1924-1925, gymnastics teacher course at GCI (Gothenburg Central Institute) from 1926-1928, service at LKE (Land Survey Office) from 1929-1930, KHS (War College) from 1930-1932, grenade throwing course in 1933, anti-tank course in 1937. Land surveying assistant from 1914-1915, district manager at Insurance A-B Fylgia since 1942, owns a real estate agency. Board member of Jämtland-Härjedalen gymnastic association from 1933-1939, Swedish walking association from 1934-1939, and more. Study visits to France in 1925-1926, travel in Central Europe in 1921, visits to England, Belgium, South, Central, and North America, Mexico, Canada, and other countries in 1930, Baltic states and Finland in 1932, travel in North and South Europe in 1939, Switzerland and Italy in 1947. Writings: A large number of newspaper articles on political, national economic, and religious issues. Hobbies: horse riding, car and canoeing sports. RSO (Royal Order of the Sword), Gymnastics and Sports Association Gold Medal, Gymnastics Promotion Gold Medal, National Sports Medal, gold medals in general sports, military sports, skiing, shooting, and pistol shooting, Army shooting medal for rifle and machine gun, fencing medal, and more.
